query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 Una medesma lingua pria mi morse, 2 sì che mi tinse l’una e l’altra guancia, 3 e poi la medicina mi riporse;
query.error: **English:** 1 A single tongue first wounded me, 2 so that it stained both my cheeks, 3 and then it brought me the medicine;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 così od’ io che solea far la lancia 5 d’Achille e del suo padre esser cagione 6 prima di trista e poi di buona mancia.
query.error: **English:** 4 thus I know that I used to make the lance 5 of Achilles and his father the cause 6 first of sad and then of happy fortune.
query.result: 4 ðus ic ða ongeat ðæt ic ða wæpna geworhte, 5 ða ðe wæron ðam æðelum Ahile and his fæder, 6 ærest to yrmðe and siððan to æghwylcum gode.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 Noi demmo il dosso al misero vallone 8 su per la ripa che ’l cinge dintorno, 9 attraversando sanza alcun sermone.
query.error: **English:** 7 We turned our backs on the wretched valley 8 and climbed the bank that encircles it all around, 9 crossing over without speaking a word.
query.result: 7 We forleton ðone wædla wænne 8 uppon ðone hlæw ðe hine ymbclyppeð, 9 ðurh ða dene butan ænigum spræce.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 Quiv’ era men che notte e men che giorno, 11 sì che ’l viso m’andava innanzi poco; 12 ma io senti’ sonare un alto corno,
query.error: **English:** 10 Here it was less than night and less than day, 11 so that my vision went forward but a little; 12 but I heard a loud horn sound,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 tanto ch’avrebbe ogne tuon fatto fioco, 14 che, contra sé la sua via seguitando, 15 dirizzò li occhi miei tutti ad un loco.
query.error: **English:** 13 so loud that it would have made any thunder seem faint, 14 which, following its way against itself, 15 directed my eyes all to one place.
query.result: 13 swa ðæt ælc ðunor ðuhte me lyt ðærwið, 14 ðæt, ongean hine his weg secende, 15 gerihte mine eagan ealle to anum stede.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 Dopo la dolorosa rotta, quando 17 Carlo Magno perdé la santa gesta, 18 non sonò sì terribilmente Orlando.
query.error: **English:** 16 After the sorrowful rout, when 17 Charlemagne lost the holy army, 18 Orlando did not sound his horn so terribly.
query.result: 16 Æfter ðære heanlicum hryre, ða 17 Carl se cyning forleas his cempan, 18 ne bleow swa ðæs beorna byme.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 Poco portäi in là volta la testa, 20 che me parve veder molte alte torri; 21 ond’ io: «Maestro, dì, che terra è questa?».
query.error: **English:** 19 I had turned my head a little way, 20 when it seemed to me that I saw many high towers; 21 and I said: "Master, tell me, what land is this?".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 Ed elli a me: «Però che tu trascorri 23 per le tenebre troppo da la lungi, 24 avvien che poi nel maginare abborri.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 Tu vedrai ben, se tu là ti congiungi, 26 quanto ’l senso s’inganna di lontano; 27 però alquanto più te stesso pungi».

106 Non fu tremoto già tanto rubesto, 107 che scotesse una torre così forte, 108 come Fïalte a scuotersi fu presto.
